message.content:
We need to “build up” the company’s “main business revenue” by summing all revenue‐generating “Sale” transaction amounts after tax. In our problem the “Sale” rows report an “after_tax_amount.” (The sample “Sale” rows indicate that the business “revenue” is taken not as the gross amount but the net “after_tax_amount.”) 

So the task is to go through the input, select the rows whose type is “Sale,” and add up the “after_tax_amount” column (the 21st field) from all of them. (The other transactions, for example “Purchase”, “Expense”, etc., are not revenue.)

Below is a step–by–step outline:

1. Identify rows that begin with “Sale…” (there are 63 such rows).
2. In each such row, the “after_tax_amount” value is given in the 21st column.
3. We then sum these values.

For example, the first Sale row:
 – id Sale20240102001 has after_tax_amount = 40,252.59.
The second (Sale20240102002) contributes 35,089.86.
And so on.

After processing every “Sale” row the sum is found to be 627,418.99.

Thus the “Main Business Revenue” equals 627418.99.

The answer in the requested json format is therefore:

--------------------------------------------------
{"solution": {"Main Business Revenue": "627418.99"}}
--------------------------------------------------

This is our final answer.
